meanings.definition: Used to express excitement or enthusiasm.
meanings.sent1: Cowabunga! I can't wait to go to the park.
meanings.sent2: When the team won the game, they all shouted cowabunga.
meanings.sent3: As the magician pulled a rabbit out of his hat, the audience shouted cowabunga in amazement.
meanings.sent4: The news of the surprise party for her birthday made her shout cowabunga with joy.
meanings.sent5: The children's faces lit up with cowabunga when they saw the ice cream truck approaching.

meanings.definition: A cry of joy or triumph.
meanings.sent1: The cowabunga of the crowd filled the stadium after the winning goal.
meanings.sent2: His cowabunga echoed through the forest as he found the hidden treasure.
meanings.sent3: The cowabunga of the birthday girl could be heard from across the room when she opened her present.
meanings.sent4: The cowabunga of victory rang in their ears as they crossed the finish line first.
meanings.sent5: The cowabunga of the fans was deafening as their team scored the winning touchdown.

meanings.definition: An exclamation of surprise or amazement.
meanings.sent1: Cowabunga! I never expected to see a shooting star.
meanings.sent2: When the magician made the rabbit disappear, the audience gasped cowabunga.
meanings.sent3: Cowabunga! That's the biggest pizza I've ever seen!
meanings.sent4: The sight of the double rainbow made everyone shout cowabunga in amazement.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected plot twist in the movie left the audience shouting cowabunga in surprise.
